<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/02/mitt-romney-criticizes-ray-dalio-for-evasive-comments-on-china?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Dalio Dilly-Dallies on China
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/02/mitt-romney-criticizes-ray-dalio-for-evasive-comments-on-china?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Ray Dalio " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/1bb0fac516b7ad0d19db3bb5180113a00a073221-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Kimberly White/Getty Images for TechCrunch</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ray Dalio is the billionaire founder of Bridgewater Associates, the world’s largest hedge fund, so when he opens his mouth, people listen. And in the case of Dalio’s recent remarks about China, some people listened...then went, “Well that was weird.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Wednesday, Dalio was asked during a CNBC appearance how he could square his firm’s investments in China with the government’s alleged human rights abuses and the sudden disappearances of people from public life. Dalio offered an <a href="https://www.nationalreview.com/news/ray-dalio-defends-investments-in-china-despite-human-rights-abuses-ccp-behaves-like-a-strict-parent/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">extremely evasive response</a>, saying he “can’t be an expert in those types of things.” He added, “As a top-down country what they are doing is they behave like a strict parent.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Utah Sen. Mitt Romney, who said he was a friend of the “brilliant” Dalio, <a href="https://www.axios.com/mitt-romney-ray-dalio-china-investment-aaf96620-8b59-4b18-9438-45f0373f345b.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">scolded</a> his pal on Twitter yesterday. Dalio’s “feigned ignorance of China’s horrific abuses and rationalization of complicit investments there is a sad moral lapse,” Romney said.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/ray-dalios-bridgewater-raises-1-25-billion-for-its-largest-china-fund-yet-11637759912?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">background</a> on Bridgewater’s recent Chinese investments:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Dalio is a longtime China bull, and Bridgewater just raised $1.25 billion for its third fund in the country, according to the WSJ.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’s a tiny amount relative to Bridgewater’s $150 billion in assets, but the fund is one of the biggest from any foreign private-fund manager in China, the Journal wrote.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Of course, Bridgewater is one of many US firms being challenged recently about their business ventures in China, especially with the Beijing Winter Olympics just two months out. Airbnb, a top Olympics sponsor, lists a <a href="https://www.axios.com/airbnb-xinjiang-listings-sanctions-china-766dae2f-91e0-4a3e-9656-544ef8f35db0.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dozen homes</a> for rent on land owned by a US government-sanctioned organization in the Xinjiang region, Axios found.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Women’s Tennis Association has been an outlier in its confrontational response to Chinese government’s actions, announcing this week it’ll suspend tournaments in China following the treatment of star Peng Shuai.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>When asked whether the Olympics should be moved out of China, major Olympics sponsors like Coca-Cola, Visa, and Allianz channeled their inner Dalio, saying they’ll continue to support the Games no matter where they’re hosted.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we're here: </strong>The Chinese ride-hailing giant Didi said it would <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/didi-global-plans-to-delist-from-new-york-stock-exchange-11638495158?mod=hp_lead_pos2" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">delist</a> from the New York Stock Exchange and go public in Hong Kong following a cybersecurity probe by the Chinese government.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/02/biden-s-new-winter-covid-plan?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Biden Prepares for an Omicron Winter
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/02/biden-s-new-winter-covid-plan?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Game of Thrones Winter is Coming gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=402 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-11-01/image-63ab0d5dd38366c258d3526e0b42a4ab7f07bb20-500x300-gif/GameofThronesWinterisCominggif.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Game of Thrones Winter is Coming gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-11-01/image-63ab0d5dd38366c258d3526e0b42a4ab7f07bb20-500x300-gif/GameofThronesWinterisCominggif.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To make sure Omicron doesn’t interfere with everyone’s buckwild holiday schedule of cookie exchanges and sitting silently in your grandma’s living room, President Biden <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/12/02/omicron-covid-variant-us-tightens-travel-testing-requirements-mask-mandates.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">revealed</a> a new winter Covid plan yesterday. The goal is to tame the new variant while keeping the country open for business.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Travel:</strong> All travelers entering the US will need to show a negative Covid test within 24 hours of their flight, regardless of their vaccination status. American citizens can still fly domestically and internationally without any proof of vaccination.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Biden administration also extended the federal mask mandate for airplanes, trains, and buses through March.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">At-home tests:</strong> To grease the Covid testing wheels, Biden said private insurers must reimburse the costs of at-home tests, which only sounds great if you’ve never tried to navigate a Blue Cross portal. The government will also double the originally pledged number of 25 million free tests to 50 million for community and rural health clinics. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What else?</strong> The 9-pronged plan also involves ramping up booster shot access and vaccinating more young people. The president said that as of yesterday more than 4 million 5-to-11 year olds and 15 million adolescents have been vaccinated.<em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/02/the-ftc-sued-to-block-the-biggest-semiconductor-deal-in-history?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Nvidia Gets Stiff Armed By the FTC
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/02/the-ftc-sued-to-block-the-biggest-semiconductor-deal-in-history?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="ARM-branded chip" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/f50d3700b4cb35042babcbd5e487cc7b576cb539-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Federal Trade Commission checked their list and decided Nvidia shouldn't get a present this year. The agency sued to block Nvidia’s <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/12/02/ftc-sues-to-block-nvidias-40-billion-acquisition-of-arm.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$40 billion acquisition</a> of British chip designer Arm from SoftBank on Thursday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This deal, which would be the largest in semiconductor history, has been heavily scrutinized globally on antitrust grounds since it was first announced in September 2020. The FTC suit is the biggest roadblock so far, and puts the deal in serious jeopardy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Arm serves as both a supplier and a licenser to semiconductor companies like Nvidia and, according to the FTC, receives access to competitive information by working with them. The FTC voted 4–0 in favor of blocking the merger, with a trial set for August 2022.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>This is Biden-appointed FTC Chair Lina Khan’s first attempt to block a major merger, and it likely won’t be her last. Khan, an antitrust scholar, is a longtime critic of large tech mergers, and both Amazon and Facebook were <a href="https://www.cnet.com/news/facebook-and-amazon-are-rattled-by-lina-khan-the-new-ftc-chair/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rattled by her appointment</a>. In recent months, the agency, along with regulators in the UK and Australia, have become increasingly hostile toward tech deals like Nvidia’s.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/02/key-performance-indicators-december-3?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Ford F-150" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/edf19511a9da5a4898e82e1a1bc48e6ab236de4c-951x535.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Ford</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Ford’s F-Series pickup is the <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/12/02/ford-pickup-remains-americas-top-selling-truck-for-45th-year.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bestselling vehicle</a> in the US for the 40th consecutive year, the company said, chip shortage be darned. But supply chain snags could knock the Chevy Silverado from the No. 2 spot and give it to the Ram pickup truck.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“The trigger wasn't pulled, I didn't pull the trigger.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last night on ABC, Alec Baldwin gave his <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/12/02/1060818520/alec-baldwin-rust-set-shooting-abc-interview?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first interview</a> since the fatal shooting of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins. Baldwin said he doesn’t know how live ammunition ended up on the <em>Rust </em>film set, nor how the gun fired as he held it.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The 100 best songs of 2021. (<a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/12/02/1054377950/the-100-best-songs-of-2021-page-1?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NPR</a>)</p>
</div>

of Bridgewater Associates, the world’s largest hedge fund, so when he opens his mouth, people listen. And in the case of Dalio’s recent remarks about China, some people listened...then went, “Well that was weird.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Wednesday, Dalio was asked during a CNBC appearance how he could square his firm’s investments in China with the government’s alleged human rights abuses and the sudden disappearances of people from public life. Dalio offered an \u003ca href=\"https://www.nationalreview.com/news/ray-dalio-defends-investments-in-china-despite-human-rights-abuses-ccp-behaves-like-a-strict-parent/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eextremely evasive response\u003c/a\u003e, saying he “can’t be an expert in those types of things.” He added, “As a top-down country what they are doing is they behave like a strict parent.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUtah Sen. Mitt Romney, who said he was a friend of the “brilliant” Dalio, \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/mitt-romney-ray-dalio-china-investment-aaf96620-8b59-4b18-9438-45f0373f345b.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003escolded\u003c/a\u003e his pal on Twitter yesterday. Dalio’s “feigned ignorance of China’s horrific abuses and rationalization of complicit investments there is a sad moral lapse,” Romney said.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/ray-dalios-bridgewater-raises-1-25-billion-for-its-largest-china-fund-yet-11637759912?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebackground\u003c/a\u003e on Bridgewater’s recent Chinese investments:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDalio is a longtime China bull, and Bridgewater just raised $1.25 billion for its third fund in the country, according to the WSJ.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’s a tiny amount relative to Bridgewater’s $150 billion in assets, but the fund is one of the biggest from any foreign private-fund manager in China, the Journal wrote.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOf course, Bridgewater is one of many US firms being challenged recently about their business ventures in China, especially with the Beijing Winter Olympics just two months out. Airbnb, a top Olympics sponsor, lists a \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/airbnb-xinjiang-listings-sanctions-china-766dae2f-91e0-4a3e-9656-544ef8f35db0.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edozen homes\u003c/a\u003e for rent on land owned by a US government-sanctioned organization in the Xinjiang region, Axios found.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Women’s Tennis Association has been an outlier in its confrontational response to Chinese government’s actions, announcing this week it’ll suspend tournaments in China following the treatment of star Peng Shuai.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eWhen asked whether the Olympics should be moved out of China, major Olympics sponsors like Coca-Cola, Visa, and Allianz channeled their inner Dalio, saying they’ll continue to support the Games no matter where they’re hosted.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we're here: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Chinese ride-hailing giant Didi said it would \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/didi-global-plans-to-delist-from-new-york-stock-exchange-11638495158?mod=hp_lead_pos2\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edelist\u003c/a\u003e from the New York Stock Exchange and go public in Hong Kong following a cybersecurity probe by the Chinese government.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo make sure Omicron doesn’t interfere with everyone’s buckwild holiday schedule of cookie exchanges and sitting silently in your grandma’s living room, President Biden \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/12/02/omicron-covid-variant-us-tightens-travel-testing-requirements-mask-mandates.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erevealed\u003c/a\u003e a new winter Covid plan yesterday. The goal is to tame the new variant while keeping the country open for business.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTravel:\u003c/strong\u003e All travelers entering the US will need to show a negative Covid test within 24 hours of their flight, regardless of their vaccination status. American citizens can still fly domestically and internationally without any proof of vaccination.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Biden administration also extended the federal mask mandate for airplanes, trains, and buses through March.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAt-home tests:\u003c/strong\u003e To grease the Covid testing wheels, Biden said private insurers must reimburse the costs of at-home tests, which only sounds great if you’ve never tried to navigate a Blue Cross portal. The government will also double the originally pledged number of 25 million free tests to 50 million for community and rural health clinics. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat else?\u003c/strong\u003e The 9-pronged plan also involves ramping up booster shot access and vaccinating more young people. The president said that as of yesterday more than 4 million 5-to-11 year olds and 15 million adolescents have been vaccinated.\u003cem\u003e—MM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"ARM-branded chip\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/f50d3700b4cb35042babcbd5e487cc7b576cb539-1500x1000.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Federal Trade Commission checked their list and decided Nvidia shouldn't get a present this year. The agency sued to block Nvidia’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/12/02/ftc-sues-to-block-nvidias-40-billion-acquisition-of-arm.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$40 billion acquisition\u003c/a\u003e of British chip designer Arm from SoftBank on Thursday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis deal, which would be the largest in semiconductor history, has been heavily scrutinized globally on antitrust grounds since it was first announced in September 2020. The FTC suit is the biggest roadblock so far, and puts the deal in serious jeopardy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eArm serves as both a supplier and a licenser to semiconductor companies like Nvidia and, according to the FTC, receives access to competitive information by working with them. The FTC voted 4–0 in favor of blocking the merger, with a trial set for August 2022.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThis is Biden-appointed FTC Chair Lina Khan’s first attempt to block a major merger, and it likely won’t be her last. Khan, an antitrust scholar, is a longtime critic of large tech mergers, and both Amazon and Facebook were \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnet.com/news/facebook-and-amazon-are-rattled-by-lina-khan-the-new-ftc-chair/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erattled by her appointment\u003c/a\u003e. In recent months, the agency, along with regulators in the UK and Australia, have become increasingly hostile toward tech deals like Nvidia’s.—\u003cem\u003eMK\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\"
